note.p: Birth: Rumigny, near Rheims, France (15 March or 15 May 1713)

Career: Friend of Jacques Cassini; was the first to determine accurately the length of an arc of the meridian; Professor of Mathematics, College Mazarin (1740); went to the Cape of Good Hope (1750-1754); determined the position of more than 10,000 stars
References: Sir Gavin de Beer and Max H Hey, 'The First Ascent of Mont Blanc' in NR 1954-55 vol 11 pp 236-255
Notes: Forenames hyphenated in DSB. Index to BR gives birth date as 15 May 1713; DSB gives 15 March 1713
